On Monday, 04/24/2017, at 2:30pm, a bank in the 3700
 block of Blomington Street was robbed by a lone male. The suspect fled 
with an undisclosed amount of cash. Members of the Robbery Unit and the 
FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the 
3100 block of North Nevada Avenue was robbed for an undisclosed amount 
of cash. Detectives from the robbery unit responded and assumed the 
investigation.On Monday, 04/24/2017, at 2:30pm, a bank in the 3700
 block of Blomington Street was robbed by a lone male. The suspect fled 
with an undisclosed amount of cash. Members of the Robbery Unit and the 
FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On Tuesday, 04/25/2017, at 10:29am, a bank in the

3100 block of North Nevada Avenue was robbed for an undisclosed amount 
of cash. Detectives from the robbery unit responded and assumed the

 block of Blomington Street was robbed by a lone male. The suspect fled 
with an undisclosed amount of cash. Members of the Robbery Unit and the 
FBI responded and assumed the investigation.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD

 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD

the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did

to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business,

his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD

 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in

pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon

pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but

his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon

pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business,

officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a
 report of a robbery at the Walgreens store at 4470 Royal Pine Dr.  The 
investigation determined that a white male, about 5'6" to 5'9" tall with
 a medium build had entered the store and presented a note to the 
cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched

cashier demanding money.  The cashier complied and the suspect fled the 
scene.  During the robbery, no weapon was seen, but the suspect did 
suggest that they were armed with a weapon.  Nobody was injured in the 
event.On the above date and time Officers were dispatched 
to a reported robbery alarm at a Diamond Shamrock, 3115 Sinton Rd. Upon 
arrival officers learned a white male, 30-35 years old, 5'09", 165 
pounds wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans entered the business, 
displayed a knife and demanded money.  The Robber was unsuccessful in 
his attempt and fled the scene on foot. A K-9 track was attempted but 
the suspect was not located.On 04/22/17 at approximately 0059 hours, CSPD 
officers responded to a personal robbery with a weapon in the 2700 block
 of N Powers Blvd.  The initial investigation showed the victim was 
walking along in the 4900 block of Constitution Avenue when a SUV pulled
 alongside of him.  Several males exited the vehicle with their faces 
covered.  One of the males was armed with a handgun and demanded money. 
 The males then fled eastbound on Constitution Avenue with some of the 
victims property and money.  The victim wasnt injured during the 
incident.  Officers checked the area with negative results.  The 
investigation is ongoing.On 4/19/17 at around 2:34 pm, officers responded to a

clothes and ski goggles entered the business with a gun.  Suspect 1 took
 the money drawer from the cash register while suspects 2 & 3 loaded
 a backpack with food.  All three suspects left on foot. No shots fired,
 no reported injuries. K-9 track was completed.  At this time no 
suspects have been located.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 {Release at Will}1 white male and 2 black males wearing all dark

 a backpack with food.  All three suspects left on foot. No shots fired,
 no reported injuries. K-9 track was completed.  At this time no 
suspects have been located.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 {Release at Will}1 white male and 2 black males wearing all dark

 the money drawer from the cash register while suspects 2 & 3 loaded
 a backpack with food.  All three suspects left on foot. No shots fired,
 no reported injuries. K-9 track was completed.  At this time no 
suspects have been located.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 {Release at Will}1 white male and 2 black males wearing all dark

suspects have been located.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 {Release at Will}1 white male and 2 black males wearing all dark 
clothes and ski goggles entered the business with a gun.  Suspect 1 took
 the money drawer from the cash register while suspects 2 & 3 loaded
 a backpack with food.  All three suspects left on foot. No shots fired,
 no reported injuries. K-9 track was completed.  At this time no 
suspects have been located.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 {Release at Will}1 white male and 2 black males wearing all dark

 a backpack with food.  All three suspects left on foot. No shots fired,
 no reported injuries. K-9 track was completed.  At this time no 
suspects have been located.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit

  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit

  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit

  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit

  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the

suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched

scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM, 
officers from the Gold Hill Division responded to a fast food restaurant
 in the 1700 block of E. Platte Avenue on a reported attempted robbery. 
 A lone man had ordered a lot of food and tried to pay with counterfeit 
money.  When denied the man created a disturbance by demanding his food,
 threatening to kill people, pushing people and breaking cash registers.
  The man left the store before officers arrived.   On 03/02/2017 at approximately 0054 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 4600 block of 
Austin Bluffs Pkwy. Upon the officers arrival, the suspects had fled 
the business. The suspects were described as males wearing dark 
clothing. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the 
suspects. No injuries were reported and no arrests have been made. The 
investigation is ongoing.At 8:41 PM; Stetson Hills Officers were dispatched 
to private residence near Freemont Elementary School located at 5110 El 
Camino Dr. with reference to a robbery.  The investigation revealed that
 the sixteen year old male victim was walking home from the school where
 he was playing basketball.  Our victim was approached by two male 
suspects, who punched him in the face, took his hat, a cellular phone 
and he dropped his basketball which may have been taken during the 
robbery as well.  The victim received a minor injury that did not 
require treatment.  The suspects were described as two African American 
teens, 59 and 59 with thin builds.  Uniformed officers arrived on 
scene within minutes and canvased the area and spoke with neighbors in 
the area, but the suspects fled the area without being apprehended. The 
investigation is continuing.On March 4th, 2017, at approximately 6:30AM,

 for service for a home invasion in progress.  The reporting party was 
able to exit the apartment as the suspects made entry to contact the 
police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium

as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium

the residence, pulled out a gun, and demanded money.On the above date and time, Officers received a call
 for service for a home invasion in progress.  The reporting party was 
able to exit the apartment as the suspects made entry to contact the 
police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium 
build and short brown hair.On 2/23/17 at approximately 2031 hours officers

 for service for a home invasion in progress.  The reporting party was 
able to exit the apartment as the suspects made entry to contact the 
police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium 
build and short brown hair.On 2/23/17 at approximately 2031 hours officers

able to exit the apartment as the suspects made entry to contact the 
police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium

police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium

responded to a burglary that just occurred where shots were fired.  
Officers contacted the victim who stated an unknown black male entered 
the residence, pulled out a gun, and demanded money.On the above date and time, Officers received a call
 for service for a home invasion in progress.  The reporting party was 
able to exit the apartment as the suspects made entry to contact the 
police. Two suspects fled the area prior to Police arrival and one 
remained on scene. Officers were able to take one suspect into custody 
as he exited the front door without incident. Investigation is 
continuing, but there is no threat to the public as it appears to be a 
targeted robbery. A female suspect is described as 5'5" with a medium 
build and short brown hair.On 2/23/17 at approximately 2031 hours officers

responded to a burglary that just occurred where shots were fired.  
Officers contacted the victim who stated an unknown black male entered 
the residence, pulled out a gun, and demanded money.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described

but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM,

amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
