Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described

but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM,

amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described

but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered

and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call for service reference
 a Robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of N. 
Academy Blvd.  Upon the officers arrival, the suspect had fled the 
business with an undisclosed amount of money. The suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male wearing a black hoodie. Officers searched the area 
but were unable to locate the suspect.  No injuries were reported and no
 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the

 arrests have been made.  The investigation is ongoing.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the front lobby of the Super 8 Motel carrying a firearm.  The male stole
 an undisclosed amount of currency from a cash register before fleeing 
the area.  No one was injured during this incident.On the above date and time, a male suspect entered 
the 7-eleven store, brandished a firearm and demanded money.  He fled 
the area with an undisclosed amount of currency.  No one was injured 
during this incident.On 02-19-2017 at approximately 2350 hours, the 
Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On Wednesday February 22nd, 2017, approx. 9:27PM, 
officers of the Colorado Springs Police Dept. responded to 5600 N. Union
 Blvd, the Kwik Way store regarding a robbery. The investigation 
revealed an unknown suspect entered the store threatening he had a gun 
and demanded money. The suspect left the area on foot. A K-9 unit 
responded but was unsuccessful at locating the suspect. There was no one
 hurt as a result of this incident. The suspect obtained an unknown 
amount of money. Anyone with information about this incident please call
 the Colorado Springs Police Dept. at 444-7000. On 02/19/2017 at approximately 2249 hours, the

Colorado Springs Police Department received a call of a robbery in 
progress at a convenience store located in the area of 2700 Dublin Blvd.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to

 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask

 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described

commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to

business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a

over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The

vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask

 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described

commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to

business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a

over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The

vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask

 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a
 business located in the 2400 block of N. Union Blvd and attempted to 
commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/17, about 9:30PM, two women were in a 
vehicle, in the Canyon Ridge MHP, when the two were accosted by a masked
 robber who demanded money from them.  They refused to hand over their 
money or purses.  The man hit the women on their faces with a pistol, 
took one of the purses, and fled on foot to the west.  Officers flooded 
the area and a K9 track was attempted with negative results.  The 
victims' injuries appeared to be minor.  The lone suspect was described 
as a Hispanic male, wearing a dark hoodie, dark pants, and a black mask 
over the lower part of his face.On 02/14/27, at 402 am, two armed suspects entered  a

commit a Robbery.  The suspects were unable to get anything from the 
business and left east on foot.On 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At
 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills 
Division were informed of a Robbery with a weapon at local area business
 in the 4300 block of South Carefree Circle.  Three armed men entered 
the store with handguns and stole money and items from the business.  
The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot.

 No vehicle was seenOn 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At
 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills

The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot. 
 No vehicle was seenOn 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At

the store with handguns and stole money and items from the business.  
The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot. 
 No vehicle was seenOn 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At
 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills

 in the 4300 block of South Carefree Circle.  Three armed men entered 
the store with handguns and stole money and items from the business.  
The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot. 
 No vehicle was seenOn 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At
 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills

 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills 
Division were informed of a Robbery with a weapon at local area business
 in the 4300 block of South Carefree Circle.  Three armed men entered 
the store with handguns and stole money and items from the business.  
The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot. 
 No vehicle was seenOn 02/14/2017 at approximately 01:30 AM, officers 
from the Gold Hill Division were dispatched to the 800 block of North 
Nevada Avenue in regards to an Assault call. The victim stated that 
while walking to a convenience store in the area, he was attacked by two
 unknown suspects. The victim stated that the two suspects hit him with 
an unknown object causing a serious laceration. The suspects took an 
undisclosed amount of personal property from the victim and fled the 
area. The suspects were only described as wearing all black clothing. At
 the time of this entry no arrests have been made.On 02/14/17 at 2:34am officers of the Stetson Hills 
Division were informed of a Robbery with a weapon at local area business
 in the 4300 block of South Carefree Circle.  Three armed men entered 
the store with handguns and stole money and items from the business.  
The suspects came from the east and left in the same direction on foot.
